name: Khalil Center
mission: Our wellness centers integrate Islamic spiritual approaches into professional psychology to help achieve optimal, holistic health by providing a wide variety of mental health services.
theoryOfChange: Khalil Center utilizes an "integrative treatment framework" or "Traditional Islamically Integrated Psychotherapy (TIIP) model" to guide its approach to mental healthcare. This framework outlines Islamic beliefs regarding health, pathology, human ontology, and epistemology, and integrates modern psychological science to address psychological, spiritual, and communal health. The TIIP model emphasizes psychological reconstruction, behavioral reformation, and spiritual elevation. It serves as a structured approach for integrating contemporary behavioral science into an inherently Islamic framework, rooted in an Islamic epistemological and ontological framework.

evaluationSources: Practice-based evidence study published in Spirituality in Clinical Practice
Research published in Journal of Muslim Mental Health

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://khalilcenter.com/donate/zakat (Source: https://khalilcenter.com/donate/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

all_citations.claim: The Khalil Foundation provides clinical mental health services and community education.
The charity is Zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for fund distribution.
The organization reported total revenue of $2,272,898 and a program expense ratio of 71.2%.
The center tracks outcomes through clinical appointments scheduled and professional training scholarships distributed.
Program metrics include total psychotherapy sessions delivered and didactic trainings provided.
The foundation offers various giving methods and donation options for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 67/100 score due to its high fundraising efficiency and strong niche alignment, though its overall impact score is moderated by the high-cost nature of clinical capacity building.
areas_for_improvement: Limited liquidity with only 2.4 months of working capital available
High cost per beneficiary relative to large-scale global health interventions

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is high (39/50) due to the organization's specialized focus on global health through a faith-based lens, making it a high-fit option for Muslim donors [2]. The charity is ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE and maintains a clear policy for distributing funds across valid asnaf categories [2][6].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates moderate impact (28/50) by focusing on capacity building through professional training scholarships and psychotherapy sessions [4][5]. While clinical services are resource-intensive with a cost per beneficiary of approximately $907.87, the organization maintains a solid 71.2% program expense ratio [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Khalil Foundation, operating as the Khalil Center, integrates spiritual wellness with modern psychology to provide comprehensive mental health services to the Muslim community.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised
Strong alignment with Muslim donor values through Zakat-eligible clinical services
Diverse service model including psychotherapy sessions and didactic trainings
baseline_narrative.summary: The Khalil Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing clinical mental health services, community education, and professional training through an Islamic psychological framework [1][4]. In the most recent fiscal period, the organization reported a total revenue of $2,272,898 while maintaining a program expense ratio of 71.2% [3].

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's significant program service revenue provides a steady income stream that partially mitigates the low cash reserves.

case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="29">limited liquidity</cite> and the inherent high cost of providing specialized clinical care.

confidence.notes: Strong alignment data but limited external financial ratings.

alignment.explanation: Alignment is high due to <cite id="26">explicit zakat programs</cite> and addressing the <cite id="27">urgent global health need</cite> for culturally competent mental healthcare.
alignment.improvement: The organization could improve alignment by <cite id="28">expanding services to more underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust the Khalil Center due to its <cite id="20">100% independent board</cite> and consistent reporting of <cite id="21">verified outcomes</cite> through annual reports.
credibility.improvement: Credibility could be further enhanced by increasing the <cite id="22">board size beyond the current 3 members</cite> to ensure more robust oversight.

impact.explanation: The center shows strong directness through <cite id="23">capacity building and direct psychotherapy</cite>, though the <cite id="24">71.2% program ratio</cite> is slightly below the peer median.
impact.improvement: To improve impact scores, the organization should <cite id="25">build reserves toward a 3-12 month target</cite> to ensure long-term service continuity.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize culturally-sensitive mental health services and want to support the professionalization of Islamic psychology through zakat-eligible giving.
donor_motivations: Want to address the mental health crisis within the Muslim community
Value the integration of faith and science in clinical practice
Seek to fulfill zakat through specialized healthcare services
Support long-term capacity building through professional training
giving_considerations: Clinical care is high-cost and serves fewer individuals than mass-distribution charities
The organization is in a growth phase with lean financial reserves
Donations support both direct patient care and systemic academic research
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking the highest number of beneficiaries served per dollar or those looking for large-scale emergency disaster relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects verified outcome tracking of sessions and trainings across multiple years, though external RCT-level evaluations are not present.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The Khalil Center utilizes an Islamically integrated model to improve mental health outcomes, combining clinical therapy with community didactic training to create a holistic support ecosystem.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Tracking session volume and training reach ensures that the specialized model is actually reaching the community at scale.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: High demand for mental health services and a <cite id="32">3-year revenue CAGR of -0.7%</cite> suggests a need for increased donor support to maintain growth.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: USA, Canada, UK, Pakistan, Turkey, Qatar

strengths.detail: The organization demonstrates remarkable fiscal discipline, spending only <cite id="9">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions.
The center successfully scaled its operations to schedule <cite id="10">13,065 clinical appointments</cite> in a single reporting year.
The organization provides <cite id="11">zakat-eligible clinical services</cite> specifically for the poor and needy (fuqara and masakin).

strengths_deep_dive: The Khalil Center's strength lies in its dual-revenue model and specialized focus. Unlike many purely donor-dependent charities, it generated <cite id="12">$1,476,207 in program service revenue</cite> in 2023, indicating a sustainable demand for its clinical offerings. This is balanced by <cite id="13">$796,691 in public contributions</cite>, which allows the center to offer <cite id="14">professional training scholarships</cite> and subsidize care for those unable to pay. Their governance is marked by transparency, featuring a board with <cite id="15">100% independent members</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Khalil Foundation, operating as the Khalil Center, is a pioneering mental health organization that <cite id="1">integrates spiritual wellness with modern psychology</cite> to serve the Muslim community. Since its <cite id="2">founding in 2010</cite>, the center has addressed the unique psychological needs of Muslims through a model that combines clinical expertise with Islamic theological principles. The organization operates at a significant scale for a specialized provider, reporting <cite id="3">$2,272,898 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. Their impact is evidenced by the delivery of <cite id="4">70,136 total psychotherapy sessions</cite> and the facilitation of <cite id="5">324 didactic trainings</cite> as reported in their recent impact data. Beyond direct clinical care, the Khalil Center serves as a hub for <cite id="6">professional training and research</cite>, offering scholarships and developing the School of Islamic Psychology to build long-term community capacity. The organization maintains a <cite id="7">71.2% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor funds directly support mental health services and community education across its <cite id="8">multiple locations in the USA, Canada, and overseas</cite>.
